Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution based on religion
Legal_Framework: International Refugee Protection Act, Convention refugee definition
Evidence_Requirement: Credible risk of persecution, evidence of raids and arrests
Institutional_Action: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division decision
Evidence_Type: Witnessed raids, church destructions, arrests, inconsistent enforcement patterns
Nature_of_Participation: Active participation in unregistered house church
Temporal_Context: Ongoing persecution at time of claim
Legal_Statute: IRPA, Article 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Complaint_Issues: Dismissal of claim due to lack of summons and perceived low risk
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA
Protection_Claim: Need for international protection due to state persecution
State_Protection_Assessment: Inadequate state protection in China for unregistered religious groups
Credibility: Credible testimony supported by evidence of persecution
Risk_Nature: Serious harm including detention and suppression of religious practice
Enforcement_Action: Raids and arrests by Chinese authorities
Legal_Basis: 1951 Refugee Convention, as incorporated by IRPA
